<div class=content-center>
<h1 style="font-size: calc(1.5rem + 0.30vw); padding-bottom: 0;">
Forecasting for decision-making:<br>
an epidemiological & ecological perspective
</h1>
July 24 - 28, 2023 - <a href="http://www.fields.utoronto.ca/activities/23-24/forecasting" target="_blank">The Fields Institute</a>
</div>

<div class=content-left>
<br>
The **2023 CEFI Summer School** was a 5-day short course on building decision-relevant forecasts. 

**Lectures** topics and hands-on exercises covered:
<ul>
<li>Producing reproducible forecasts</li>
<li>Forecasting with static vs. dynamic models</li>
<li>Understanding and propagating uncertainties</li>
<li>Incorporating decision-making priorities into forecasts</li>
<li>Engaging with a lens of data sovereignty and data justice</li>
<li>Strategies for effective communication</li>
</ul>

Participants also worked together on **group projects**, developing a forecasting model and learning to troubleshoot, iterate, and refine their models. Group projects focused on three case-studies: infectious disease control, fisheries management, or water quality monitoring. 

The course concluded with group presentations on the models and forecasts developed during the week.

</div>
